headline: Take-Two Loss Narrows, Sales Climb on Higher Bookings
summary: The videogame company posted a loss of $92.9 million, or 50 cents a share, in the quarter ended Dec. 31, compared with a loss of $125.2 million, or 71 cents a share, a year earlier.

raw.headline: Take-Two Loss Narrows, Sales Climb on Higher Bookings
raw.summary: The videogame company posted a loss of $92.9 million, or 50 cents a share, in the quarter ended Dec. 31, compared with a loss of $125.2 million, or 71 cents a share, a year earlier.

headline: Take-Two: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had a loss of 50 cents. Earnings, adjusted for amortization costs and stock option expense, came to $1.23 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Take-Two: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had a loss of 50 cents. Earnings, adjusted for amortization costs and stock option expense, came to $1.23 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.

headline: Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
summary: Video game publisher Take Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 24.9% year on year to $1.70 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($1.60 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 5.2% above what analysts were expecting. Its GAAP loss of $0.50 per share was 28.6% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Video Game Maker Take-Two Crushes December-Quarter Estimates
summary: Video game publisher Take-Two Interactive Software crushed estimates for its fiscal third quarter and guided higher than views for the current period.

raw.headline: Video Game Maker Take-Two Crushes December-Quarter Estimates
raw.summary: Video game publisher Take-Two Interactive Software crushed estimates for its fiscal third quarter and guided higher than views for the current period.

headline: Take-Two raises annual bookings forecast, sticks with 'GTA VI' November launch
summary: Take-Two Interactive raised its annual bookings forecast on Tuesday, betting on strong ​sales of its premium sports, action and ‌mobile titles as it gears up to launch the highly ‌anticipated "Grand Theft Auto VI" in November.  While "GTA VI" is expected to make the company billions at launch, ⁠investors will also ‌look at how Take-Two and developers Rockstar Games plan to update the title ‍post launch to keep players engaged and spending on its online features.  "We continue to project record levels of ​net bookings in fiscal 2027, which we believe ‌will establish a new financial baseline for our business," said company CEO Strauss Zelnick.

headline: Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. Reports Results for Fiscal Third Quarter 2026
summary: NEW YORK, February 03, 2026--Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ:TTWO) today reported results for the third quarter of its fiscal year 2026, ended December 31, 2025. For further information, please see the third quarter fiscal 2026 results slide deck posted to the Company’s investor relations website at take2games.com/ir.

headline: Will Google’s Genie 3 Shift Take-Two (TTWO) From AI Follower To Gaming Innovation Leader?
summary: In recent days, concerns about AI-driven disruption in game development intensified after Google unveiled its Genie 3/Project Genie world-model technology, drawing direct comparisons to the tools used by established publishers like Take-Two Interactive Software ahead of its upcoming earnings release. This has turned generative AI from a distant concept into a practical competitive question for Take-Two, sharpening investor focus on how the company might incorporate or respond to such tools...
